member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Object that keeps the list of events that trigger post back.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack.ToString
member.summary: String formatted for visual designer.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack.Reset
member.summary: Reset all properties to their defaults.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack.GroupExpanded
member.summary: Automatically post back to the server when group was expanded and corresponding event handler was attached to UltraWebListBar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack.GroupCollapsed
member.summary: Automatically post back to the server when group was collapsed and corresponding event handler was attached to UltraWebListBar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack.GroupClicked
member.summary: Automatically post back to the server when group was clicked and corresponding event handler was attached to UltraWebListBar.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack.ItemClicked
member.summary: Automatically post back to the server when item was clicked and corresponding event handler was attached to UltraWebListBar.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Use the following properties to specify a javascript event handler for trapping client side events. These events can be used instead of costly postbacks, which require round-tripping data to the server.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ClientSideEvents.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

summary.p: Called Before an Item is selected. This can be used to cancel selection.
Called After an Item has been selected.
Called before a Group is selected. This event can be used to cancel selection.

remarks.p: Note: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType is set to Listbar.

summary.p: Called after a Group has been selected.

remarks.p: Note: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType is set to Listbar.

summary.p: Called after the client-side Listbar object has been initialized, and is ready for processing.
Called before an ExplorerBar's group is expanded.

remarks.p: Note: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.p: Called after an ExplorerBar's group has been expanded.

remarks.p: Note: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.p: Called before an ExplorerBar's group is collapsed.

remarks.p: Note: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.p: Called after an ExplorerBar's group has been collapsed.

remarks.p: Note: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.p: Called when the user mouses over a Group or Item.
Called when the user mouses out of a Group or Item.
Called before a GroupDrag starts. This event can be used to cancel the GroupMove.

remarks.p: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's AllowGroupMoving property is set to GroupSwapping.

summary.p: Called after a GroupDrag completes.

remarks.p: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's AllowGroupMoving property is set to GroupSwapping.

summary.p: Called while the user drags a group.

remarks.p: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's AllowGroupMoving property is set to GroupSwapping.

summary.p: Called when the user clicks on an ExplorerBar group's header.

remarks.p: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType property is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.p: Called when the user double clicks on an ExplorerBar group's header.

remarks.p: This event will only be fired if the UltraWebListbar's ViewType property is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.para: A custom Type Editor for class styles. This editor allows the style class names to be added to a list from which the user can select. This is possible because the property grid is signed with a "reflection" permission that allows for private reflection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.CursorUIEditor.#ctor
member.summary: Default no parameter constructor.

summary.para: Creates a list box to show in the property grid.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
Private function to fill the contents of our list box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.
Called when the user clicks something in the list box. We close the drop down at this time.
Owner draw list box displays classess in the list box
We override this from Control so we can designate that the return key should be used for input. In other words, we want return to come to us, not be treated as the "OK" to dismiss a dialog.
We handle keyboard processing here for the return key. We treat this key like a click on the list box.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group
member.summary: Represents a Group in the Listbar. Acts as a parent for Items.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor, to create a new Group object.

remarks.p: This constructor will create a new Group object, and give it an empty collection. It will assign the value "Group" to the Text property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.#ctor(System.String)

summary.p: One parameter constructor to create a Group object.

remarks.p: This constructor will create a new Group object, and give it an empty Items collection. It will assign the value passed in the text parameter to the property.

member.param: A string which will be assigned to the property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.#ctor(System.String,System.String)

summary.p: Creates a new Group with the specified Text and Key values.

member.param: The Text used for this group.
A unique Key used to identify this Group.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.#ctor(System.String,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style)
member.summary: Two parameter constructor used for creating a new Group object.
member.param: A string which will be assigned to the property.
An object, used for this groups , , and properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.FindControl(System.String)

summary.p: Searches this Group's template or UserControl to find a control with the specified id.

remarks.p: This method will recursively search all children of this group. If no match is found, null will be returned.

member.param: The id of the child control to find.
member.returns: A reference to the control, or null if no match was found.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ToString
member.summary: A short description of the Group.
member.returns: The group's .

summary.p: Resets all properties set on this group.
Returns an instance of the userControl specified in the property. This will be null if the UserControlUrl property is not set.
The text to be used as a tooltip for this group.
Determines whether this group will respond to user interaction. When this group is not enabled, none of its items will be enabled either.
The UserControlUrl allows you to host a UserControl inside of a Group, insted of Items.
The Expanded property controls whether the Items area is visible for this Group.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.TargetUrl
member.summary: A URL which will be navigated to when this Item is clicked on.

remarks.p: When set, the TargetUrl will be displayed in the frame specified by the property. The TargetUrl should be fully qualifyied, for example "http://www.infragistics.com". You can also use this property to execute a scripting call. For example:
javascript:myFunction();

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.TargetFrame
member.summary: Used to determine what frame the should be displayed in.

remarks.p: You can specify a frame in a frameset, an IFrame, "_blank" for a new window, or leave the value blank to use the UltraWebListbar's internal Frame.
Note: The internal fram will only appear when the UltraWebListbar's is set to a value other than it's default value of 100%.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Key
member.summary: Returns or sets a unique string identifier for this Group within the Groups collection

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Text
member.summary: The text that will be displayed when this Group is rendered.

remarks.p: You can control text wrapping by setting the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ItemSelectionStyle
member.summary: Determines how items should be selected in this group.

remarks.p: This property determines how an item will be selected. If set to , the selected style will be applied to the item's image and text, as a whole unit. Use to inherit the value from the UltraWebListbar object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ItemIconStyle
member.summary: Determines how an Item's image should be displayed.

remarks.p: This property determines how an Item's image will be displayed in relation to it's text. Specify to inherit the value from the UltraWebListbar object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Tag
member.summary: Used to hold any extra data for specific development needs.

remarks.p: By default, this is set to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.TextAlign
member.summary: Determines how the of this group should be aligned inside of the button it is rendered in.

remarks.p: This property is used to set whether the is Left, Right, or Center aligned.

summary.p: Used to determine how an Item's text should be aligned with relation to its image.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ItemAlign
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of Items in this Group.

remarks.p: Determines whether the items in this group will be Left, Center, or Right aligned. This can be overriden by each Item individually, by setting the Item's Align property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ID
member.summary: The ID that is used to identify this Group object inside of the HTML.

remarks.p: It consists of "Group_" and this groups index in the collection.

Note: This property is Read only. The value is created dynamically, and changes according to the Group's index. This ID is only unique inside of the Groups collection. The final ID used when rendering this group will consist of the UltraWebListbar.ID and the value of this ID.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.AccessKey
member.summary: Keyboard access key for this group.

remarks.p: The action that occurs is equivalent to the mouse click/doubleclick on this group depending on the value of the HeaderClickAction property.
The access-key is the feature of a browser, which is triggered by the keyboard entry of Alt+key.
This property is supported only for InternetExplorer, which allows to set focus to the <DIV> and <TD> html elements.
If the <u> string is not found in the Text of this group and the value of AccessKey is set as the UPPER-case-letter, then the first found access-character in the Text is rendered with underscore.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Index
member.summary: Returns the zero based index of this item, it it's owning Items Collection.
member.remarks: Returns -1 if this item is not part of an Items Collection.

summary.p: The position this ExplorerBar group will be displayed at.

remarks.p: This property can be used to move a group up or down with out changing its index in the Groups collection. This value will also reflect where the group is currently located. This can change if AllowGroupMoving is set to GroupSwapping.
Note: This property is only available for the ExplorerBar style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Template
member.summary: Templates are used as a means for the a Group to host controls, instead of just Items.
member.remarks: Setting the template content of any Group can be done at DesignTime by right clicking the UltraWebListbar, and selecting "Edit Template" menu item. You can also use the property, to host a UserControl inside of the Group.

summary.p: The collection of appearance properties that will be applied to an ExplorerBar's Header.

remarks.p: When is set to true, the values here will be merged with the values defined on the UltrawebListbar's DefaultHeaderAppearance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ButtonStyle
member.summary: The style that will be used when rendering this Group as a button in the Listbar.

remarks.p: The ButtonStyle is applied to a group button when not selected, or moused over. When set, ButtonStyle overrides . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ButtonSelectedStyle
member.summary: The style that will be used when rendering this Group as button in the Listbar, if it is the currently selected group.

remarks.p: The ButtonSelectedStyle is applied to a group button when selected, even if moused over. When set, ButtonSelectedStyle overrides . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.ButtonHoverStyle
member.summary: The style that will be applied when this Group button is moused over.

remarks.p: The ButtonHoverStyle is the style which is applied to a group button when moused over. When set, ButtonHoverStyle overrides . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your style class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.
Note: If this group is the the ButtonHoverStyle will not be applied.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.DefaultItemStyle
member.summary: The style used when rendering an for this group.

remarks.p: When set, this style will be used for any in this group. It overrides , and is overridden by . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.DefaultItemSelectedStyle
member.summary: The style used when an in this group is selected.

remarks.p: When set, this style will be applied to any in this group when selected. It overrides , and is overridden by . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.DefaultItemHoverStyle
member.summary: This style is applied when an in this group is moused over.

remarks.p: When set, this style will be applied to any in this group, when moused over. It overrides , and is overridden by . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.GroupStyle
member.summary: The style used for the area that contains the in this group.

remarks.p: This is the area between the set of group buttons which appear at the top of the listbar, and set of group buttons which appear at the bottom. When set, this value will override . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Control
member.summary: A reference to the UltraWebListbar that this Group belongs to.

remarks.p: A Group must be added to the collection before this property can be used.
Note: This property is ReadOnly

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group.Items
member.summary: A reference to the collection that belongs to this group.

remarks.p: This should never be null, but may be empty.

summary.p: The TemplateGroup is used to wrap an Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Group object, so that it can host templates. This class is not intended to be used directly.

member.summary: Infragistics Internal Use.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.HeaderAppearance
member.summary: Summary description for HeaderAppearance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.HeaderAppearance.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor.

summary.p: Resets all properties on this object.
The set of appearance properties that should be applied to a group header when it is in its expanded state.
The set of appearance properties that should be applied to a group header when it is in its collapsed state.
The set of appearance properties that should be applied to a group header when it is moused over.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.HeaderStyle
member.summary: Summary description for HeaderStyle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.HeaderStyle.#ctor
member.summary: Default Constructor.

summary.p: All CssStyle related properties.
A relative path to an Image file, which should be used as this Header's Icon.

remarks.p: The image specified here will be relative to path defined in the UltraWebListbar's ImageDirectory property. If you want the path to be relative to the current directory, you should prefix the path with "./"

summary.p: A relative path to an Image file, which should be used as this Header's Expansion Button.

remarks.p: The image specified here will be relative to path defined in the UltraWebListbar's ImageDirectory property. If you want the path to be relative to the current directory, you should prefix the path with "./"

summary.p: A relative path to an Image file, which should be used as this Header's left edge. This image will shown as the left 5 pixels of the header. For the XPExplorerBar look, you would want to specify an image with it's top left corner rounded off.

remarks.p: The image specified here will be relative to path defined in the UltraWebListbar's ImageDirectory property. If you want the path to be relative to the current directory, you should prefix the path with "./"

summary.p: A relative path to an Image file, which should be used as this Header's right edge. This image will shown as the right 5 pixels of the header. For the XPExplorerBar look, you would want to specify an image with it's top right corner rounded off.

remarks.p: The image specified here will be relative to path defined in the UltraWebListbar's ImageDirectory property. If you want the path to be relative to the current directory, you should prefix the path with "./"

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item
member.summary: The Item object is the last object in the UltraWebListbar object hierarchy. Visually, an Item is composed of Text and an Image.

member.summary: Creates a new Item with text "Item" and empty styles.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Item with the specified text, and sets its image.
member.param: The value to be used for this Item's Text property.
The value to be used for this Items's Image property.

summary.p: Creates a new Item with the specified Text, Image, and Key values.

member.param: The Text for this item.
This Item's Image.
A unique key used to identify this item in the Items collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style)
member.summary: Creates a new Item and sets it's Text, Image, and DefaultStyle properties.

Value for this Item's Image property.
Value for this Item's Default Style.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.ToString
member.summary: A description of this Item.
member.returns: A text description of this Item, including it's value.

summary.p: The Tooltip text that will be displayed when this Item is moused over.
Determines whether this Item will respond to user interaction. If the Group, or Listbar this item belongs to is not enabled, this item will also be disabled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.Align
member.summary: The horizontal alignment of this Item.

remarks.p: Determines whether the item will be Left, Center, or Right aligned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.Image
member.summary: A relative path to the Image which should be displayed for this item.

remarks.p: When set, this image will be displayed along with the Items's . If the Item is the , the will be displayed, if set.
Note: If the property is set, this path should be relative to the ImageDirectory.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.SelectedImage
member.summary: A relative path to the Image which should be displayed for this item, when selected.

remarks.p: When set, and this Item is the , this image will be displayed along with the Items's . If not set, the image asigned to the property will be used.
Note: If the property is set, this path should be relative to the ImageDirectory.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.TargetUrl
member.summary: A URL which will be navigated to when this Item is clicked on.

remarks.p: When set, the TargetUrl will be displayed in the frame specified by the property. The TargetUrl should be fully qualifyied, for example "http://www.infragistics.com". You can also use this property to execute a scripting call. For example:
javascript:myFunction();

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.TargetFrame
member.summary: Used to determine what frame the should be displayed in.

remarks.p: You can specify a frame in a frameset, an IFrame, "_blank" for a new window, or leave the value blank to use the UltraWebListbar's internal Frame.
Note: The internal fram will only appear when the UltraWebListbar's is set to a value other than it's default value of 100%.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.Text
member.summary: The Text displayed when this Item is rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.Tag
member.summary: Used to hold any extra data for specific development needs.

remarks.p: By default, this is set to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.AccessKey
member.summary: Keyboard access key for this item.

remarks.p: The action that occurs is equivalent to the mouse click on this item.
The access-key is the feature of a browser, which is triggered by the keyboard entry of Alt+key.
This property is supported only for InternetExplorer, which allows to set focus to the <DIV> and <TD> html elements.
If the <u> string is not found in the Text of this item and the value of AccessKey is set as the UPPER-case-letter, then the first found access-character in the Text is rendered with underscore.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.Index
member.summary: Returns the zero based index of this item, it it's owning Items Collection.
member.remarks: Returns -1 if this item is not part of an Items Collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.ID
member.summary: The ID which is used to identify this Item object inside of the rendered HTML.

remarks.p: It consists of "Item_" and this groups index in the collection.

Note: This property is Read only. The value is created dynamically, and changes according to the Item's index. This ID is only unique inside of the Items collection. The final ID used when rendering this group will consist of the UltraWebListbar.ID, the index of the Group which owns this Item, and the value of this ID.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.Control
member.summary: A reference to the UltraWebListbar which this Item belongs to.

remarks.p: An Item must be added to the collection before this property can be used.
Note: This property is ReadOnly

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.SelectedStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when rendering this Item, if it is the .

remarks.p: The SelectedStyle is the style which is applied to an Item when selected, even if moused over. When set, SelectedStyle overrides , and . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.DefaultStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when rendering this Item in the Listbar if this Item is not the .

remarks.p: The DefaultStyle is the style which is applied to an Item when not selected, or moused over. When set, DefaultStyle overrides , and . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.Item.HoverStyle
member.summary: The style which will be applied when this Item is moused over, if this is not the .

remarks.p: The HoverStyle is the style which is applied to an Item when moused over, if the item is not selected. When set, HoverStyle overrides , and . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

summary.para: A custom Type Editor for class styles. This editor allows the style class names to be added to a list from which the user can select. This is possible because the property grid is signed with a "reflection" permission that allows for private reflection.
Creates a list box to show in the property grid.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The property grid will call this when it wants to display the editor for the given value.
Private function to fill the contents of our list box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor and indicates if we support painting a small representation of our value in the property grid.
Called when the user clicks something in the list box. We close the drop down at this time.
Owner draw list box displays classess in the list box
We override this from Control so we can designate that the return key should be used for input. In other words, we want return to come to us, not be treated as the "OK" to dismiss a dialog.
We handle keyboard processing here for the return key. We treat this key like a click on the list box.

member.summary: Return the list of products that this control can be licensed with

summary.p: The delegate to be used for GroupExpanded events.
The delegate to be used for GroupCollapsed events.
The delegate to be used for ItemClick events.
The delegate to be used for GroupClick events.

member.summary: Automatically reposition the UltraWebListbar vertically when the page is scrolled, keeping it in view at all times. This advanced feature is only available for uplevel browsers.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.KeepInView.No
member.summary: Do not position the UltraWebListbar dynamically.

member.summary: The possible values for the UltraWebListbar's HeaderClickAction property.

member.summary: Expand or collapse the ExplorerBar style's Group when the Header is clicked.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.HeaderClickAction.ExpandOnDoubleClick
member.summary: Expand or collapse the ExplorerBar style's Group when the Header is double clicked.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.HeaderClickAction.None
member.summary: Do not expand or collapse the ExplorerBar style's Group when the Header is clicked or double clicked. The only way to expand or collapse a group when using this setting, is to click directly on the Expansion Indicator.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AllowGroupMoving
member.summary: All possible values related to the UltraWebListbar's AllowGroupMoving property.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AllowGroupMoving.GroupSwapping
member.summary: Allow Groups to be repositioned on the client when using the ExplorerBar style. This advanced feature will only work on IE5+ and NS7+.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.AllowGroupMoving.None
member.summary: Do not allow groups to be moved on the client.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ViewType
member.summary: The ViewType determines both behavior and appearance for the UltraWebListbar.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ViewType.Listbar
member.summary: The default style, seen in Microsoft's Outlook Bar.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ViewType.ExplorerBar
member.summary: The visual appearance and behavior of the Windows XP Explorer Bar. This style will allow multiple groups to be expanded at one time.

summary.p: Used to determine what type of HTML should be rendered.
Determine what type of HTML to render, by finding out the browser type and version.
Render HTML that can be seen in a DownLevel browser only. This setting is useful to determine what a downlevel browser will see, without having one installed on your machine.
Render HTML that will only display properly in an UpLevel browser, which supports DHTML.
Expand effects can be used to animate the ExplorerBar's group expansion.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ExpandEffect.Slide
member.summary: This effect will slide the Items into or out of view. This effect will only work on Internet Explorer 5 and up, and Netscape 7 and up. In Internet Explorer the slide effect is also accompanied by a fade effect.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.ExpandEffect.None
member.summary: No animation.

summary.p: Used to determine how an Item's Text should be aligned to it's Image.
Align the Text top to the middle of the Image.
Align the Text top to the Top of the Image.
Align the Text bottom to the bottom of the Image.
Align the middle of the Text to the middle of the Image.
Align the top of the Text to the Bottom of the Image.
Use parent's setting, if any.
Used to determine how an Item's Image should be displayed.
Use value set on parent object.
Note: This is not an acceptable value for on the UltraWebListbar object, since there is no parent object to inherit the value from.
Display the above the .
Display the to the left of the .

Display the image to the left of any text. This differs from the Small setting by wrapping all text to the right of the image, instead of around and under the image. If you use this setting, the Align property for the item will be ignored. Each item will be aligned to the Left.
Displays a solid Disk to the left of each item.
Displays a circle to the left of each item.
Displays a square to the left of each item.
Used to determine how an Item should be selected.
Apply the SelectedStyle to the area containing the , and .
Apply the SelectedStyle to the only.
Use value set on parent object.
Note: This is not an acceptable value for since there is no parent object to inherit the value from.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.BorderStyle
member.summary: The BorderSytle for the WebListBar

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width for the WebListBar

summary.p: A reference to the currently selected item.

remarks.p: This is a reference to the actual Item object. You can use this property to get or set the currently selected item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultGroupStyle
member.summary: The style used for the area which contains the Items of this group.

remarks.p: This is the area between the set of group buttons which appear at the top of the listbar, and set of group buttons which appear at the bottom. This value is overridden by a Group's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

summary.p: A directory where images can be found.

remarks.p: When this property is set, any image used in the UltraWebListbar will be relative to this directory. For special case, you can use "./" to prefix an image to specify NOT to use the ImageDirectory specified here, and use the project directory instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.KeepInView

summary.p: This property will automatically reposition the listbar on the client when the page is scrolled, to keep it in the viewable area.

member.remarks: This property can only be set for one UltraWebListbar on a page. Also, in order to function properly, your PageLayout must be set to Absolute or GridLayout.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.GroupExpandEffect

summary.p: Gets or sets the effect used when an ExplorerBar group is expanded or collapsed.

member.remarks: This property only applies to the ExplorerBar style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.HeaderClickAction

summary.p: Controls how a Group header in the ExplorerBar style, should respond to mouse clicks. Use this property to set whether a group can be expanded by clicking or double clicking the group's header.

member.remarks: This property is only available when is set to ExplorerBar.

summary.p: Controls the appearance and behavior of the control. Use this property to choose between common styles such as the MS Outlookbar, or the XP Explorer Bar.

remarks.p: Note: Some properties of the UltraWebListbar will be unavailable depending on the value of this property. For example, when the ViewType is set to Listbar, there will be no DefaultGroupHeaderAppearance. Conversely, when the ViewType is set to ExplorerBar, there will be no DefaultGroupButtonStyle.

summary.p: The collection of styles which apply to an ExplorerBar header. This property is only available when the ViewType is set to ExplorerBar.

remarks.p: This collection of appearance information can be overridden by setting a particular Group's HeaderAppearance.

summary.p: The empty space left between the bottom of one group, and the top of another. This property is only available for the ExplorerBar ViewType.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.AllowGroupMoving

summary.p: Controls how a Group can be repositioned on the Client browser. If set to ,ExplorerBar groups can be repositioned within the control, by dragging up or down.

member.remarks: GroupSwapping is only available for IE5 and up, and Netscape 7 and up.

summary.p: This property controls how an object in the listbar resolves its style properties.

remarks.p: By setting this property to true, you can force the UltraWebListbar to merge individual properties of each style, instead of only using one style object exclusively. This results in a more intuitive style hierarchy. For each style set, the DefaultStyle will be used as the base for the Hover and Selected Styles. In the case of the ExplorerBar, the ExpandedStyle is used as the base for the Hover and Collapsed styles.

summary.p: Where supported this property will force text not to wrap when the width is smaller than the length of the text.

remarks.p: Note: Setting this property will have no effect in Netscape.

summary.p: A relative path to the Infragistics Common JavaScript file.

remarks.p: The common JavaScript file is shared by all Infragistics WebControls. By default it is located at ig_common/scripts/ig_csom.js
Note: This JavaScript file is required for the UltraWebListbar to function properly at runtime.

summary.p: A relative path to the JavaScript file.

remarks.p: The default JavaScript file is located at /ig_common/20043/Scripts/ig_weblistbar.js Other javascript files are also located in the same directory, and are required for the UltraWebListbar to function. These files (ig_weblistbarIE4.js, ig_weblistbarNS4.js, ig_weblistbarASC.js) must all be in the same directory as the file specified here. In addition, the UltraWebListbar uses a Common JavaScript file. This file location is set using the property.
Note: The JavaScript file is required for the UltraWebListbar to function properly at runtime.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.BrowserTarget
member.summary: Sets which type of browser the html should be rendered for. This property can be used to force the UltraWebListbar to Render the same, no matter what browser the request came from. This may be useful during development, to get an idea of how clients using downlevel browsers will see the page, with out having to use a downlevel browser yourself.

summary.p: The list of Events that can fire in the client browser. These events will only fire on UpLevel browsers. Each event is listed as a property with at text value indicating the function to call to handle the event.
Render all Text as HyperLinks.

remarks.p: When true, the text for a Group or Item will be rendered inside of an anchor tag.

summary.p: Used to determine how an Item's text should be aligned with relation to its image.

remarks.p: This property can be overriden by setting the ImageTextAlign property on a particular Group.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultItemStyle
member.summary: The style used when rendering an Item.

remarks.p: When set, this style will be used for any Item in this UltraWebListbar. It is overridden by a Group's , and by an Item's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultItemSelectedStyle
member.summary: The style used when an Item is selected.

remarks.p: When set, this style will be applied to any Item when selected. It is overridden by a Group's , and by an Item's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultItemHoverStyle
member.summary: This style is applied when an Item is moused over.

remarks.p: When set, this style will be applied to any Item when moused over. It is overridden by a Group's , and by an Item's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultGroupButtonStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when rendering a Group as a button in the Listbar.

remarks.p: The DefaultGroupButtonStyle is the style which is applied to a group button when not selected, or moused over. DefaultGroupButtonStyle is overridden by a Group's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultGroupButtonSelectedStyle
member.summary: The style which will be used when rendering a Group as button in the Listbar, if it is the currently .

remarks.p: The DefaultGroupButtonSelectedStyle is the style which is applied to a group button when selected, even if moused over. DefaultGroupButtonSelectedStyle is overridden by a Group's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.DefaultGroupButtonHoverStyle
member.summary: The style which will be applied when a Group button is moused over.

remarks.p: The DefaultGroupButtonHoverStyle is the style which is applied to a group button when moused over. DefaultGroupButtonHoverStyle is overridden by a Group's . To force the UltraWebListbar to use your own style, specify the name of your class in the CssClass property. To force the use of no style, specify "none" for the CssClass property.
Note: If this group is the the hover style will not be applied.

summary.p: The currently selected group's index.

remarks.p: Use this propert to get or set the currently SelectedGroup.
Note: This property is not available for the ExplorerBar style.

summary.p: The width of the listbar portion of the UltraWebListbar.

remarks.p: This width is subtracted from the control's width to calculate the display area's width. If 100%(default) is used, no display area will be shown.

summary.p: Determines how an Item's SelectedStyle is applied. Use this property to specify whether an Item's Hover and Selected style are applied to the entire Item (Image and Text), or just the Item's Image.

remarks.p: This property is overridden by the Group's .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.ItemIconStyle
member.summary: Determines how an Item's image should be displayed. Use this property to specify whether an Item's image should appear above the Item's text, or to the Left. You can also use this property to display Bullets to the left of an Item's text, instead of an image.

remarks.p: This property determines how an Item's image will be displayed in relation to it's text. This property is overridden by the Group's

summary.p: A reference to the collection. The groups collection contains each group that will be displayed. Groups will be displayed in the order that they appear in this collection. When using the ExplroerBar style, you will be able to change a groups visible position, without changing its position in this collection by setting the group's .

remarks.p: This property is read-only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.TabIndex
member.summary: The tab order of control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.AccessKey
member.summary: Keyboard shortcut used by control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.AutoPostBack
member.summary: List of events that will trigger automatic post back when corresponding event handler is attached.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.GroupOrder
member.summary: Internal use only. The get method is dummy. The set method is fired by LoadLostData method with value which was set by the function update(..) of ig_weblistbar.js.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebListbar.UltraWebListbar.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Internal use only. The get method is dummy. The set method is fired by LoadLostData method with value which was set by the function update(..) of ig_weblistbar.js.
